title: The Lord in the Heart as a Witness | Sri Chanchalapathi Dasa @ChanchalapathiDas
speaker: HG Chanchalapathi Dasa

segments.key_quote: So, we are always in the surveillance zone of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of CCTV surveillance to explain how Krishna is always watching us in our hearts, urging us to be honest in our bhakti.
segments.transcript: You go to a big store and there will be CCTVs in different places. They will put a board: "This area is under CCTV surveillance." That means they have put a CCTV and they are informing you. Somebody could be watching or somebody is recording. And if we see such a board there, this is a CCTV surveillance zone. We are careful. We become alert. We don't do some wrong things, right? In the Bhagavatam, it is said, Krishna is the witness of the innermost core of our heart. And the highest yogi is one who is devoted to Krishna in the innermost core of his heart. That is why in Bhakti, we cannot cheat at all. We may cheat externally, others. But Krishna is seated in the heart and he is watching. So, we are always in the surveillance zone of Krishna.
